Spacecraft¶

class orbitpy.util.Spacecraft(name=None, orbitState=None, spacecraftBus=None, instrument=None, _id=None)[source]¶

Class to store and handle the spacecraft attributes.

Variables

  • name (str) – Name of the spacecraft.

  • orbitState (orbitpy.util.OrbitState) – Orbit specifications of the spacecraft (defined at a specific time).

  • spacecraftBus (orbitpy.util.SpacecraftBus) – Spacecraft bus.

  • instrument (list, instrupy.Instrument) – List of instrument(s) belonging to the spacecraft.

  • _id (str) – Unique identifier.

Methods Summary

__init__([name, orbitState, spacecraftBus, ...])

Initialize an entity.

add_instrument(new_instru)

Add input instrument to the spacecraft's list of instruments.

from_dict(d)

Parses Spacecraft object from a dictionary.

from_json(json_doc)

Parses an entity from a JSON-formatted string, dictionary, or file.

get_id()

Get spacecraft identifier.

get_instrument([sensor_id])

Get Instrument object (from a list of instruments present in the Spacecraft object.) corresponding to the specified sensor id.

to_dict()

Translate the Spacecraft object to a Python dictionary such that it can be uniquely reconstructed back from the dictionary.

to_json([file])

Serializes this entity to a JSON-formatted string or file.

Methods Documentation

__init__(name=None, orbitState=None, spacecraftBus=None, instrument=None, _id=None)[source]¶

Initialize an entity.

Parameters

  • _id (str) – (default: None)

  • _type (str) – (default: “Entity”)

add_instrument(new_instru)[source]¶

Add input instrument to the spacecraft’s list of instruments.

Parameters

new_instru (instrupy.base.Instrument or list, instrupy.base.Instrument) – New instrument(s) to be added to the spacecraft.

static from_dict(d)[source]¶

Parses Spacecraft object from a dictionary.

Parameters

d (dict) –

Dictionary with the spacecraft properties.

The following key/value pairs are expected:

* "name" : (str) Name of the spacecraft.
* "orbitState" : (dict) Spacecraft orbit-state specification (see :class:`orbitpy.util.OrbitState.from_dict`).
* "spacecraftBus" : (dict) Spacecraft bus specification (see :class:`orbitpy.util.SpacecraftBus.from_dict`). 
                     If missing or :class:`None`, a bus with the orientation in the ``NADIR_POINTING`` frame and convention ``REF_FRAME_ALIGNED`` is assigned. 
* "instrument": (list, dict) Instrument(s) specification (see :class:`instrupy.base.Instrument.from_dict`).
* "@id": (str/int) Spacecraft unique identifier. If missing, a random string is assigned.

Returns

Parsed python object.

Return type

orbitpy.util.Spacecraft

get_id()[source]¶

Get spacecraft identifier.

spacecraft identifier.

Return type

get_instrument(sensor_id=None)[source]¶

Get Instrument object (from a list of instruments present in the Spacecraft object.) corresponding to the specified sensor id.

Parameters

sensor_id (str or int) – Instrument identifier. If None, the first instrument in the list of instruments is returned.

Returns

Instrument corresponding to the input sensor id. If not match not found, return None.

Return type

instrupy.Instrument or None

Translate the Spacecraft object to a Python dictionary such that it can be uniquely reconstructed back from the dictionary.
